title: Recognize this encoding (in a serialization context)?
content:
I am currently trying to reverse engineer a proprietary serialization format. In some of the sections the encoding is unknown to me. What I was able to figure out:

Everything big endian, btw.

Does somebody know/recognize this encoding?

comments.text: LEB128 is a weird variable length format that uses high bits to signal if you should use the next byte or terminate. Posting the language can be helpful, as some standard encodings are used in different languages.
@douggard Well, it's not LEB128. Even your description doesn't match my description above.
Sorry, your description wasn't very clear.
